title: You’re About to See These “Gorgeous” $10 Target Decorations Everywhere (Perfect for Small Spaces!)
description: They fold flat for easy storage, too. READ MORE...
author: Olivia Harvey
excerpt: They fold flat for easy storage, too.
text: DecoratingDecor & AccessoriesShoppingWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Credit: Markus Mainka/ShutterstockWhen you live in a small space, you have to be mindful of how much holiday decor you accumulate because it all needs somewhere to go at the end of the season. And if you don’t have room for bins of Christmas decorations, then Target has a great solution: “honeycomb” trees. They’re made from folded and glued paper that creates a honeycomb-like effect when on display, but can also easily store flat and take up almost no space at all.“Honeycomb trees have been all over my feed this season!” Jessica from Target Junkie on Instagram wrote in a recent caption. “They are pretty cool! I love how they take absolutely no space when you store them away!”“I cannot describe to you how I gasped! Gorgeous,” one person commented on Jessica’s post. Another said, “I love those!!! I need them for my office STAT.”Target’s Wondershop brand carries a few different honeycomb tree sets in various colors, styles, and sizes. Just pull them out of the box, unfold them, and use the included glue dots to help the tree keep its shape and stay upright. Then, when it’s time to store them, simply undo the glue dots and fold the trees flat again for next year.Because these trees are made of paper, they’re super affordable, too. Each set will only set you back $10. “Stunning,” one Target reviewer wrote. “Very large and great quality. Amazing for storage as they can be folded up.”You can still go wild with the Christmas decor, even if you don’t have the space to store it all later. Just pick up a bunch of these honeycomb trees and place them on your mantel, windowsill, dining table, and anywhere else that needs a bit of holiday cheer. You can build an entire evergreen tree forest and then store everything in a file folder at the end of the season, no big bulky bins needed!
html:
• Decorating
  • Decor & Accessories
  • Shopping

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

When you live in a small space, you have to be mindful of how much holiday decor you accumulate because it all needs somewhere to go at the end of the season. And if you don’t have room for bins of Christmas decorations, then Target has a great solution: “honeycomb” trees. They’re made from folded and glued paper that creates a honeycomb-like effect when on display, but can also easily store flat and take up almost no space at all.

“Honeycomb trees have been all over my feed this season!” Jessica from Target Junkie on Instagram wrote in a recent caption. “They are pretty cool! I love how they take absolutely no space when you store them away!”

“I cannot describe to you how I gasped! Gorgeous,” one person commented on Jessica’s post. Another said, “I love those!!! I need them for my office STAT.”

Target’s Wondershop brand carries a few different honeycomb tree sets in various colors, styles, and sizes. Just pull them out of the box, unfold them, and use the included glue dots to help the tree keep its shape and stay upright. Then, when it’s time to store them, simply undo the glue dots and fold the trees flat again for next year.

Because these trees are made of paper, they’re super affordable, too. Each set will only set you back $10. “Stunning,” one Target reviewer wrote. “Very large and great quality. Amazing for storage as they can be folded up.”

You can still go wild with the Christmas decor, even if you don’t have the space to store it all later. Just pick up a bunch of these honeycomb trees and place them on your mantel, windowsill, dining table, and anywhere else that needs a bit of holiday cheer. You can build an entire evergreen tree forest and then store everything in a file folder at the end of the season, no big bulky bins needed!
